summary: This is a letter from U.S. Attorney R. Alexander Acosta to attorneys Jay P. Lefkowitz and Roy Black regarding the implementation of the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) with Jeffrey Epstein. It discusses the selection of a Special Master and attorney representative, victim notifications, and disputes over the scope of victims covered by the agreement.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office, led by R. Alexander Acosta, was actively working to implement the 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement with Jeffrey Epstein in August 2008.
A dispute existed over the scope of victims covered by the NPA: whether it covered only victims known at signing (September 2007) or all victims known by June 30, 2008.
The letter reveals that victim notifications had previously contained incorrect information, approved by Epstein's counsel, which Acosta felt imperative to correct.
There was ongoing litigation between the United States and two of Epstein's victims at the time of this correspondence.
The Special Master, Judge Davis, had selected Robert Josefsberg as the attorney representative, and his fees were to be paid per the NPA terms.
